snippet: Roy Moore was firm in his position that the federal judiciary had seriously overreached in its effort to impose same-sex marriage in Alabama.
abstract: Alabama Chief Justice Roy S Moore's order prohibiting state judges from issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples has thrown state's court system in turmoil, and places him once again in national spotlight; devout-Baptist Moore last drew attention in 2003, when he defied federal court order to remove Ten Commandments monument from Alabama Judicial System building.
lead_paragraph: Roy Moore was firm in his position that the federal judiciary had seriously overreached in its effort to impose same-sex marriage in Alabama.

headline.main: For Alabama Chief Justice, Soldiering in Name of God Is Nothing New
headline.print_headline: For Alabama Chief Justice, Soldiering in Name of God Is Nothing New

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
